question: 人間
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>person</kanji> <kanji>interval</kanji>. Just think of different intervals each with a different type of species. The raccoon interval... the dog interval... the person interval... they are the <vocabulary>human</vocabulary>s.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, and the reading of <ja>間</ja> is a bit of an oddball, here's a mnemonic to help you:

Did you know that the <vocabulary>human</vocabulary>s who work for <reading>Nin</reading>tendo are all called <reading>Gen</reading>ji (<ja>にんげん</ja>)? Yep, that's right, every single human ever hired by Nintendo is called Genji, without exception.
